keyword: how many calories are in a boba tea
title: How Many Calories Are in a Boba Tea?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a boba tea, including carbs, sugars, fat, and tweaks for lighter versions—based on a standard medium serving.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Boba Tea?
assumptions: Medium serving (16 oz/473 ml) with black tea, whole milk, sugar syrup, and cooked tapioca pearls; no extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shop, size, milk type, sweetness level, and pearl portion. Check menus or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard boba tea contains about 400 kcal, with high carbs from sugar and tapioca pearls.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use non-dairy milk (e.g., almond) instead of whole milk

faqs.q: How many calories are in a boba tea without pearls?
faqs.a: About 300 kcal, as pearls add ~100 kcal from carbs.

faqs.q: What makes boba tea high in calories?
faqs.a: Sugar syrup and tapioca pearls contribute most, with ~50 g sugars and 80 g carbs per serving.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie boba tea options?
faqs.a: Yes—opt for less sugar, non-dairy milk, or fruit tea bases to drop to 200–300 kcal.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in a boba tea?
faqs.a: Typically 50 g or more, equivalent to 12 teaspoons; varies by sweetness level.

faqs.q: Does boba tea have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low protein (~5 g from milk) and moderate fat (~8 g if using whole milk); mostly carbs.
